bullets.title: Always call login() before using any app API methods
bullets.content: Every AppWorld app requires authentication. Always call app.login() as the FIRST operation before making any API calls. Example: spotify.login(), venmo.login(), gmail.login(). Skipping login will cause 'access_token' errors.
bullets.author: seed

bullets.title: Use search_* methods not get_* or fetch_* for querying data
bullets.content: AppWorld APIs use search_* naming convention (e.g., spotify.search_tracks(), venmo.search_transactions()). Don't use get_* or fetch_* - those don't exist. Always check available methods for each app.
bullets.author: seed

bullets.title: Always call apis.supervisor.complete_task() at the end
bullets.content: Every AppWorld task MUST end with apis.supervisor.complete_task() to signal completion. This is required for the test framework to evaluate results. Missing this call will cause all tests to fail.
bullets.author: seed

bullets.title: Check API response structure before accessing nested fields
bullets.content: AppWorld API responses can have varying structures. Always check if fields exist before accessing them (e.g., if 'items' in response, check response.get('data'), etc.). Use .get() with defaults to avoid NoneType errors.
bullets.author: seed

bullets.title: Spotify: Get user playlists and track details separately
bullets.content: To find songs in Spotify playlists: (1) Call spotify.get_user_playlists() to get playlist IDs, (2) For each playlist, call spotify.get_playlist_tracks(playlist_id) to get track details including likes/plays.
bullets.author: seed
